source.name: Glasgow City Council
source.notes: Based on official Glasgow City Council bin guidelines. Blue bin paper/card only (every 4 weeks). Purple bin for glass. Green bin for food/garden waste. Tetra Paks NOT recyclable. Shredded paper accepted.

materials.name: Newspapers
instructions: Place in blue bin (paper and card only)
notes: Blue bin collected every 4 weeks
commonMistakes: Don't include plastic wrapping — remove it first

materials.name: Magazines and catalogues
notes: Glossy paper accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include plastic inserts or free samples

materials.name: Envelopes
instructions: Window envelopes accepted — no need to remove the plastic window
notes: Standard envelopes only
commonMistakes: Don't include padded or bubble-lined envelopes — those go in grey/black bin

materials.name: Junk mail and flyers
notes: Remove any plastic wrapping first
commonMistakes: Don't include plastic-wrapped mail without removing the wrap

materials.name: Shredded paper
instructions: Place in a paper bag or envelope
notes: Glasgow accepts shredded paper — must be contained
commonMistakes: Don't put loose shredded paper in the bin — it blows away

materials.name: Paperback books
instructions: If in good condition, consider donating
notes: Paperbacks accepted in the blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't include hardback books — the glue and binding can't be recycled

materials.name: Greeting cards
notes: Plain card only — no glitter or foil
commonMistakes: Don't include cards with glitter, foil, or musical inserts — those go in grey/black bin

materials.name: Wrapping paper (non-foil)
instructions: If it passes the 'scrunch test' (stays scrunched): blue bin
If foil-backed or glittery: grey/black bin
notes: Only plain paper wrapping is accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include metallic, foil, or glittery wrapping paper
Remove sellotape and ribbons where possible

materials.name: Clean pizza boxes
instructions: If clean or only lightly soiled: flatten and place in blue bin
If heavily greased: place in green bin (food waste)
notes: Light grease marks are fine for the blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't include boxes saturated with grease — those go in green bin

materials.name: Egg boxes (cardboard)
notes: Cardboard and pulp fibre egg boxes only
commonMistakes: Don't include polystyrene egg boxes — those go in grey/black bin

materials.name: Toilet roll and kitchen roll tubes
notes: Cardboard tubes only — not the paper towel itself
commonMistakes: Don't include the used kitchen roll — only the cardboard tube

materials.name: Cereal boxes and food sleeves
instructions: Remove and discard any plastic liner
notes: Thin card packaging accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include the plastic bag inside — that goes in grey/black bin

materials.name: Cardboard boxes
instructions: Place in or beside blue bin
notes: Must be flattened
commonMistakes: Don't leave unflattened — they take up too much space
Don't include heavily soiled cardboard

materials.name: Glass bottles
notes: Purple bin is for glass only
commonMistakes: Don't include lids or caps — metal lids go in grey/black bin
Don't include broken glass

materials.name: Glass jars
notes: All colours of glass accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include lids
Don't include broken glass or non-container glass

materials.name: Cooked food waste
instructions: Place in green bin (food and garden waste)
notes: All cooked food accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include packaging

materials.name: Raw food scraps
notes: All raw food waste accepted
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in the grey/black bin

materials.name: Tea bags
notes: Accepted in Glasgow's green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Coffee grounds and filters
instructions: Place grounds and paper filter in green bin
notes: Paper filters accepted with grounds
commonMistakes: Don't include coffee pods — empty the grounds out first

materials.name: Bread and baked goods
notes: Includes mouldy bread and stale baked goods
commonMistakes: Don't include packaging

materials.name: Meat, fish, and bones
notes: All meat and fish waste accepted including bones
commonMistakes: Don't put in grey/black bin

materials.name: Dairy waste
notes: Small amounts of liquid dairy accepted
commonMistakes: Recycle the container separately

materials.name: Fruit and vegetable scraps
notes: All fruit and veg scraps accepted
commonMistakes: Don't put in grey/black bin

materials.name: Garden waste
notes: Green bin accepts both food and garden waste in Glasgow
commonMistakes: Don't include soil, stones, or plant pots

materials.name: Small branches and twigs
instructions: Cut to fit in green bin
notes: Small woody garden waste accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include large branches or logs — take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre

materials.name: Tetra Pak cartons
notes: Tetra Pak cartons are NOT recyclable in Glasgow's kerbside collections
This is different from some other Scottish councils
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin — Glasgow does not accept cartons

materials.name: Plastic bottles
instructions: Or take to a bottle bank or recycling point
notes: Glasgow does NOT currently accept plastic bottles in kerbside bins
Changes to kerbside recycling being implemented — check glasgow.gov.uk for updates
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin — it is paper and card ONLY

materials.name: Plastic pots, tubs, and trays
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling in Glasgow
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Food tins and cans
instructions: Or take to a recycling point / can bank
notes: Glasgow does NOT currently accept tins and cans in kerbside bins
Recycling points across the city accept cans
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin — it is paper and card ONLY

materials.name: Drinks cans
instructions: Or take to a recycling point / can bank
notes: Not accepted in kerbside bins — use recycling points
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Aluminium foil
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling in Glasgow
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Aerosol cans
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling — take to recycling point if possible
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin
Don't puncture

materials.name: Plastic bags, wrappers, and cling film
notes: Not recyclable at kerbside
Some supermarkets accept soft plastics
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Polystyrene and foam packaging
notes: Not accepted in any Glasgow kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Nappies and sanitary products
instructions: Bag and place in grey/black bin
notes: Not recyclable or compostable
commonMistakes: Don't put in the green bin

materials.name: Disposable coffee cups
notes: Plastic-lined cups are not recyclable at kerbside in Glasgow
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Bubble wrap and packing materials
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Tissues and kitchen towels
notes: Not accepted in the blue bin or green bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Wallpaper
instructions: Place in grey/black bin or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Not accepted in the blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Hardback books
instructions: If in good condition, donate to a charity shop
notes: The glue and binding prevent recycling in the blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin — only paperbacks accepted

materials.name: Padded and bubble-lined envelopes
notes: Mixed materials — not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Food or liquid-soiled paper and card
instructions: Or place in green bin if it's food waste
notes: Contaminated paper and card cannot go in the blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't put soiled items in the blue bin — they contaminate clean paper

materials.name: Plastic liners and inserts
notes: Remove from cardboard packaging before recycling the cardboard
commonMistakes: Don't leave inside cardboard boxes going in the blue bin

materials.name: Plastic wrapping and shrink wrap
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Glass dishes, Pyrex, and ceramics
instructions: Wrap carefully and place in grey/black bin
notes: Different type of glass from bottles/jars — cannot be recycled together
commonMistakes: Don't put in the purple bin

materials.name: Thermal receipts
notes: Thermal paper contains BPA — contaminates paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Plastic cutlery
notes: Not recyclable at kerbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Plastic straws
notes: Too small for sorting equipment
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Household batteries
instructions: Take to a battery recycling point (supermarkets, DIY stores)
Or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Many shops have battery collection bins near the entrance
commonMistakes: Don't put in any household bin
Tape terminals of 9V and lithium batteries

materials.name: Electrical and electronic items
instructions: Take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
Small items may be accepted at some recycling points
notes: WEEE regulations require proper recycling
Delete personal data from devices
commonMistakes: Don't put in any household bin

materials.name: Large electrical appliances
instructions: Book a special uplift through Glasgow City Council
Or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Special uplift service available — check glasgow.gov.uk
commonMistakes: Don't leave at the kerbside without booking

materials.name: Paint and varnish
instructions: Take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Glasgow has recycling centres at Dawsholm, Polmadie, Shieldhall, Easter Queenslie, and Cathkin
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains
Don't put liquid paint in any bin

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Never pour down drains
commonMistakes: Don't pour into drains or soil

materials.name: Medicines and pharmaceuticals
notes: Most pharmacies accept unused medicines
commonMistakes: Don't flush down the toilet
Don't put in any bin

materials.name: Clothing and textiles
instructions: Donate to a charity shop if in good condition
Use textile recycling banks across the city
Or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Glasgow has textile banks at various locations
commonMistakes: Don't put in any kerbside bin

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Book a special uplift through Glasgow City Council
Or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Special uplift available
commonMistakes: Don't leave at the kerbside without booking

materials.name: Cooking oil and fat
instructions: Small amounts: soak onto kitchen roll and place in grey/black bin
Large amounts: take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Never pour down the drain
commonMistakes: Don't pour down the sink — causes fatbergs

materials.name: Fluorescent tubes and CFL bulbs
instructions: Take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Contains mercury — must not go in household bins
commonMistakes: Don't put in the grey/black bin or purple bin

materials.name: Car batteries
instructions: Take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
notes: Contains lead and acid
commonMistakes: Never put in any household bin

materials.name: Wax paper and baking parchment
notes: Coatings prevent recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

materials.name: Leftover pet food
notes: Treat the same as other food waste
commonMistakes: Recycle the tin at a recycling point, not in kerbside bins

materials.name: Crisp packets and snack wrappers
notes: Metallised film — not recyclable at kerbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin

recycle: Junk mail, flyers, and leaflets (blue bin)
Shredded paper in a paper bag (blue bin)
Greeting cards — plain only, no glitter (blue bin)
Clean pizza boxes and egg boxes (blue bin)
Toilet roll and kitchen roll tubes (blue bin)
Cereal boxes and food sleeves — remove plastic liner (blue bin)
Glass bottles and jars — lids removed (purple bin)
compost: All cooked and uncooked food waste (green bin)
Tea bags and coffee grounds (green bin)
Garden waste — grass, hedges, leaves, flowers (green bin)
trash: Tetra Pak cartons — NOT recyclable in Glasgow (grey/black bin)
Plastic bottles, pots, tubs, and trays (grey/black bin)
Food tins, drinks cans, aluminium foil (grey/black bin — or take to recycling point)
Plastic bags, cling film, and wrappers (grey/black bin)

recycle: Food or liquid-soiled paper and card
Plastic inserts, bubble wrap, or polystyrene
Any non-paper material in the blue bin

tips: Glasgow's blue bin is for paper and card ONLY — collected every 4 weeks
Purple bin is for glass bottles and jars only — remove lids
Green bin takes both food waste AND garden waste
Tetra Pak cartons are NOT recyclable in Glasgow's kerbside collection
Plastic bottles, tins, and cans are NOT collected at kerbside — use recycling points or take to a Household Waste Recycling Centre
Changes to kerbside recycling are being rolled out — check glasgow.gov.uk for the latest
Shredded paper must be in a paper bag or envelope before going in the blue bin
Only paperback books go in the blue bin — not hardbacks
Glasgow Household Waste Recycling Centres: Dawsholm, Polmadie, Shieldhall, Easter Queenslie, Cathkin

locations.name: Dawsholm Household Waste Recycling Centre
locations.notes: Dalsetter Avenue, Glasgow — check website for opening hours
